title: Crystal Palace boss Sam Allardyce HAPPY with Christian Benteke and Andros Townsend's post-game bust-up
text:
Townsend and Benteke argue post-game (Photo: PA Wire) Share Get football   Thank you for subscribing!   
Sam Allardyce welcomed a post-match bust-up between Christian Benteke and Andros Townsend – and is set to reward his Palace players with a week in the sun. 
The Belgium striker was furious late in the game when the England winger shot wide instead of crossing. 
And Boro keeper Victor Valdes had to separate the feuding pair at full-time as the row rumbled on. 
But Big Sam said: “It’s very good, because he loves scoring goals. He’s put a lot of work in as well.” Townsend and Benteke had a disagreement over a late run from the winger (Photo: AFP/Getty Images) Benteke had shown his anger when Townsend didn't cross (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Read More Crystal Palace 1-0 Middlesbrough: Van Aanholt strike secures vital win for Eagles 
Palace pulled the plug on a planned training camp in Dubai after the 4-0 home thrashing by Sunderland earlier this month. 
But with the March 11 match with Tottenham now rescheduled because of the FA Cup, Allardyce said: “We’ll have a look at that now this week. 
“The weather’s so poor here: since 2001, in the Premier League, apart from with Newcastle because I got sacked before I could take them away, I’ve taken every team away for the sunshine, a warm weather break. 
"It’s worked for me, so we’ll be looking at that this week to see where we can go.” poll loading Are Crystal Palace getting relegated? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
